text: Jean-Baptiste-Irénée Callot (1814-1875) was a French Roman Catholic priest. He served as the first Bishop of Oran in Oran, French Algeria from 1867 to 1875. ==Early life== Jean-Baptiste-Irénée Callot was born on November 23, 1814 in Beaujeu, Rhône, France. ==Vocation== Callot was a Professor of Theology at the University of Lyon. Callot was appointed as the vicar of the Saint Irenaeus Church in Lyon in 1856. He served as the first Bishop of Oran in Oran, French Algeria from 1867 to 1875. ==Death== Callot died on November 1, 1875 in Beaujeu, France. ==References== Category:1814 births Category:1875 deaths Category:People from Lyon Category:People from Oran Category:University of Lyon faculty Category:French Roman Catholic bishops
title: Jean-Baptiste-Irénée Callot
